Hypertable::ResponseCallback

Hypertable::ResponseCallback Class Reference

This class is used to deliver responses, corresponding to a request, back to a client. More...

Detailed Description

This class is used to deliver responses, corresponding to a request, back to a client.

Hypertable::ResponseCallback::ResponseCallback ( Comm *  comm,
EventPtr &  event_ptr 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Initializes a pointer to the Comm object and saves a pointer to the event that triggered the request.

Parameters:
comm pointer to the Comm object
event_ptr smart pointer to the event that generated the request

Member Function Documentation

int ResponseCallback::error ( int  error,
const String &  msg 
) [virtual]

Sends an error response back to the client.

The format of the response consists of the 4-byte error code followed by the error message string.

Parameters:
error error code
msg error message
Returns:
Error::OK on success or error code on failure

Definition at line 32 of file ResponseCallback.cc.

int ResponseCallback::response_ok (  )  [virtual]

Sends a a simple success response back to the client which is just simply the 4-byte error code Error::OK.

This can be used for all requests that don't have return values.

Returns:
Error::OK on success or error code on failure
